commitResults.messageBody:
There are several problems when the user input some invalid data.

KiraException will handle all the exception caused by this software.
Currently, the exceptions checked are invalid-index when marking or
unmarking, invalid command and storage out-of-bounds.

Error when parsing user input will be dealt with when Parser is
implemented.

KiraBot can now delete tasks from the list. Furthermore, the list is now
expandable. The limit exception has been removed.

The bot requires a saving function to save the session of the user.

Saving is done at every command. The save file is in csv for easy
parsing and loading.

When the bot starts up, it should read the save file, if any, and load
the state of the database.

KiraBot now reads the file and load in the saved state of the task list.
Further changes are made to change the format of the delimiters to allow
for commas in task description.

Currently, all relevant tasks with a date is stored as String. Now, a
specific format is required to save the dates and time for the tasks.

Additionally, a new command TODAY is implemented to retrieve all tasks
that are within the time frame of today.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to include more OOP and packages
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, there is no organisation for the different java files and no
dedicated class for each logic abstraction.

More classes have been implemented to separate the logic and taskList no
longer return formatted strings for each method as it is not the job.
Furthermore, Parser will manage all of the error during parsing of the
commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: Automate with Gradle, add JUnit tests
Tweak code to comply with standard

commitResults.messageBody:
With a lot of tasks, users might have a hard time finding some specific
task.

Therefore, a find command has been implemented for the user to use a
particular keyword to find all the tasks matching it.
